name: limestone quarry operation | limestone, unprocessed | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20588/documentation

Limestone is a calcareous sedimentary rock consisting essentially of carbonates. The two most important constituents are calcite and dolomite. There are variety of limestone, however the limestone used by industries in bulk quantity is a sedimentary limestone. Limestone is basic raw material for Cement production. Total production of limestone in India is 292.8 million tonne in 2014-15 year. Total consumption of limestone in India is 239.26 million tonne out of which 221.08 million tonne are consumed by Cement industry (Nearly 92.4%) 

Exporation, Mining, Drilling & Blasting

This activity ends with the unprocessed limestone, at the quarry gate.

This dataset includes all transports within the quarry (for extraction and recultivation)
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
tags: Sector: Resource Extraction; Minerals; Cement & Concrete

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data collected and analysied for year 2014-15. and has been assumed that there is no significant change in technology.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The representativeness at national scale is more than 30%. The data were represented for all geographical locations in India.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: In India, limestone mines are worked by opencast method. Captive mines are mechanised and supply feed to cement and iron & steel units.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Some missing data have been retrived from the existing ecoinvent process Limestone quarry operation/GLO (accessed on 1070823)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: For this activity sample questionnaire has been prepared and circulated to all cement manufacturing units in India. For this dataset environment statement report for limestone mining and literature has refered. Data refered from environment statement of nearly 15 cement units in India.
